DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Multifactorial Intervention Improve Diet Physical Activity Diabetics From Primary Care
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : The main objective study evaluate effect add multifactorial intervention ( ICT tool Smartphone , cardio-health ride standardized advice eat habit ) usual care increase physical activity , order reach international recommendation Increased adherence Mediterranean diet type 2 diabetic patient . Secondary objective evaluate effect intervention improve dietary pattern , cardiovascular risk factor metabolic control . Design setting : A randomise controlled clinical trial , two parallel group , aim assess effect add ICT tool group activity healthy food cardio-health ride ( intervention ) , support behavioral educational recommendation ( control ) increase physical activity adaption Mediterranean dietary pattern . Study setting : Primary Care Health Area Salamanca Research Unit La Alamedilla , belong Spanish Network Preventive Activities Health Promotion ( redIAPP ) Salamanca Institute Biomedical Research ( IBSAL ) . Study population : 200 patient Diabetes Mellitus Type 2 , age 25-70 year , sex , meet selection criterion sign informed consent . Each participant make three visit : baseline , three twelve month post-intervention . Measuring effect intervention : The validated 14-point Mediterranean Diet Adherence Screener , International Physical Activity Questionnaire ( IPAQ ) , pedometer , laboratory value include glucose glycosylated hemoglobin , quality life questionnaire ( SF -12 ) .
